intro: Macrocentrum longidens, commonly known as the long-spined spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a waxy texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous seeds. Macrocentrum longidens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
